sentences.sContent: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
sentences.sCn: 热内起初很叛逆，但不久就回归了文学主流。

sentences.sContent: ...referring to an insufficiently inquiring attitude on the part of an the george washington bridge traffic scandal, the mainstream media the least curious about what happened...
...there's no hope of that becoming a mainstream product...
...Because few mainstream publications have done in-depth features on regular African-American women...

trans.tranOther: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods
